But we knew that we couldn't do it alone, so we reached out to white allies who shared our vision of equality and justice. We worked together, building trust and understanding, and slowly but surely, we made progress. It wasn't always smooth sailing, of course. There were plenty of setbacks and challenges along the way, but we never gave up. We kept pushing forward, always believing that a better future was possible. And in the end, our efforts paid off. We achieved significant gains in civil rights, and we paved the way for future generations to build on that progress.</s>
